instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Work fine but no image on LCD
threads.message:
Hello, I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that is working well when plugged in Display Port on external display. With internal display plugged in I have no image on it (but still on external display). The Apple Logo on the back cover is ON when the OS boot is over and I have <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> = 40V, which supposed to mean that the LCD is not seen. The LCD is not cracked and both connector and cable looks good. The board also looks good.

So far, I have replace the LCD cable, the LCD assembly and finally the LCD connector, still have <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> = 40V

Here some measurement on J8300 :
- <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> = 40V
- <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_EDP_R</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
- <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 5V
- <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_LCD</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
- <SIGNAL>I2C_TCON_SCL</SIGNAL> = 0V
- <SIGNAL>I2C_TCON_SDA</SIGNAL> = 0V
- <SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><0> = 0V as <1>, <2>, <3>
- <SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><0> = 0V as <1>, <2>, <3>
- <SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C_P</SIGNAL><0> = 0.46V as <1>, <2>, <3>
- <SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML_C_N</SIGNAL><0> = 0.46V as <1>, <2>, <3>

No short on J8300, FL8300 to FL8303 seems fine, all <SIGNAL>DP_INT_ML</SIGNAL> lines have continuity. Could 40V on PPVOUT be a logic board problem or is it often because of the display/connector ?

Thank you for your help, I really hope the problem doesn't come from <CHIP>U0500</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Work fine but no image on LCD
threads.message:
Is retina display, so 40V is OK.
Check all C832x capacitors and traces.
Also try known good COMPATIBLE screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Work fine but no image on LCD
threads.message:
Ok so it's a good news if 40V is normal, all my power rails seems to be fine on the LCD connector. I'll try an other assembly as soon as I find an other one.

When you say "check all C832x", you mean check for a short on the pins or there is an other way to check a capacitor ? All traces between C832x and F830x are fine (bip in diode mode).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Work fine but no image on LCD
threads.message:
Check if no component is knocked off.
Also check diode mode to ground on these caps; on the CPU side.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Work fine but no image on LCD
threads.message:
Every components are present. Diode mode on these caps gives me 0.267. Does someone have a good <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> to confirm me these values ?

Also, I measured <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_OR_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U8330</CHIP>, I have both 3.3V. I ordered a new assembly, I'll give you some news as soon as it arrive.

Finally, I'd like to correct my previous measurements on <SIGNAL>I2C_TCON_SCL</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>I2C_TCON_SDA</SIGNAL>, they are both 3.3V.
